skill.summary: A guide to creating Claude Code Skills.

security_audit.summary: The skill is a static markdown guide with no executable code or scripts. No data access, network activity, or command execution is present.

content.user_title: Create a Claude Code skill with clear structure
content.value_statement: You need a concise reference to build a Claude Code skill that triggers correctly. This guide explains required files, naming rules, and organization patterns so you can write a compliant skill.
actual_capabilities: Explains required SKILL.md frontmatter and sections
Lists optional directories and files for complex skills
Documents personal and project skill storage paths
Provides file reference and script call examples
limitations: No automation or scripts are included
No validation or packaging instructions are provided
No tool integrations or APIs are described
Examples are descriptive only, not runnable

use_cases.title: Start a new skill
use_cases.description: Use the guide to draft a compliant SKILL.md and pick a safe folder layout.

use_cases.title: Standardize skills
use_cases.description: Apply naming and organization guidance to keep team skills consistent.

use_cases.title: Refine an existing skill
use_cases.description: Check structure, references, and limits against the documented requirements.

prompt_templates.title: List required files
prompt_templates.scenario: I am starting a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: List the required files and frontmatter fields for a Claude Code skill.

prompt_templates.title: Choose a structure
prompt_templates.scenario: My skill needs references and scripts
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a folder structure for a skill with references and helper scripts.

prompt_templates.title: Naming guidance
prompt_templates.scenario: I need a compliant skill name
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a skill name that follows the naming rules and explain why.

prompt_templates.title: Progressive disclosure
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to split content between SKILL.md and reference files.

output_examples.input: Summarize the recommended skill folder layout
output: SKILL.md is required and includes frontmatter
Optional files include references, examples, scripts, and templates
Use progressive disclosure to keep SKILL.md concise

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for performance
Link to reference files instead of duplicating details
anti_patterns: Adding extra documentation files like README or CHANGELOG
Using vague skill names such as Helper or Tools
Deeply nested references beyond one level

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is tool-agnostic and mentions Claude Code layouts.

faq.question: What limits should I follow?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and respect name and description length limits.

faq.question: Does it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: No. It is a documentation-only guide without tool integrations.

faq.question: Does it handle sensitive data safely?
faq.answer: It does not access data, files, or networks, so it does not process sensitive data.

faq.question: What if my skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Review the frontmatter description and ensure it clearly states when to use the skill.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full template generator?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not generate or validate files.
